STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 29, 2024
Maureen Clore
ANTRIM/CHARLEVOIX/EMMET COUNTY DHHS
2229 SUMMIT PARK DR,
PETOSKEY, MI, 49770-8636
RE: License#: CP240201034
Dear Ms. Clore:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 07/25/2024. Due to a violation of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (a) Child's name.
One of three files reviewed did not document the foster parent received the child’s
name before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (b) Child's date of birth.

One of three files reviewed did not document the foster parent received the child’s
date of birth before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (c) Available known information about the
child's health.
One of three files reviewed did not document the foster parent received available
known information about the child's health before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (d) Any known history of abuse or neglect
of the child.
One of three files reviewed did not document the foster parent received any
known history of abuse or neglect of the child before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (e) All known emotional and
psychological factors relating to the care
of the child.
One of three files reviewed did not document the foster parent received any
known history of emotional and psychological factors relating to the care of the
child.

CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (f) All known behaviors of the child.
One of three files reviewed did not document the foster parent received all known
behaviors of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (g) Circumstances necessitating
placement or replacement of the child.
One of three files reviewed did not document circumstances necessitating
placement or replacement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (h) Any other known information to enable
the foster parent to provide a stable, safe,
and healthy environment for the foster
child and the foster family, including
information about siblings who do not
reside in the foster home as provided in
federal law.
One of three files reviewed did not document any other known information to
enable the foster parent to provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the
foster child and the foster family, including information about siblings who do not
reside in the foster home as provided in federal law.

CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (i) Name of assigned social service
worker.
One of three files reviewed did not document the name of assigned social service
worker before placement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (j) Authorization to provide routine and
emergency medical care.
One of three files reviewed did not document the foster parent received
authorization to provide routine and emergency medical care before placement of
t he child.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• DCWL review of Corrective Action Plans (CAP). The agency was informed
that starting January 1, 2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will be reviewed
with the agency at three months and six months. The assigned Consultant for the
agency will work with the agency in conducting CAP reviews. This process for
special investigation CAP reviews was implemented previously.

• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was informed
that all training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly for foster
care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may be carrying
a caseload.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted an approved corrective action plan on 08/22/2023 in response
to two policy violations established during the Interim inspection completed on July
25, 2023. The current renewal inspection did not establish repeat violations of
those policies indicating the CAP was successful in preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was reviewed. The assessment was
thorough and well written. The assessment detailed areas of needed improvement
and efforts to achieve and maintain compliance with rules and policy. The agency
conducts random quality reviews of licensing and foster care files. Barriers noted
were daily supervision of youth, which was needed at times, efforts regarding
placement changes, frequent and needed home visits, and the overall
requirements of policy and licensing for foster care.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their respective supervisors and
the agency administration. Staff also reported they are part of a supportive team
which works well together.

Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern local DHHS office building. The agency was
recently refurbished and is well maintained. There is sufficient office space for
employees. CHRI documents were observed to be secured. A cross shredder was
also observed.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
July 29, 2024
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 29, 2024
